poem:
Title: Injustice Elizabethan

Garry Glitter, a tarnished star,
Whose unspeakable harms echo far.
Real name Gadd - etched in ice,
A cold monument to his vice.

Justice whispers in the night,
Victims inching toward the light.
Deftly navigating traumatic abyss,
Seeking recompense for stolen bliss.

Glitter's gavel, struck with a tone,
Resonates in the marrow of the bone.
In the high court's hush, truth takes its stand,
For justice to bloom in this scarred land.
